description:
Always wondered about how websites were made, and how to make yours ? This is the opportunity to learn. Be warned : this is a workshop, so don't expect long lectures : you'll be working as much (or even more) than us !

Programming for the web is a craft - it's all about practice.

At the end of the evening, what HTML, CSS and JavaScript are, and what they are used for, should be much clearer - as you'll have coded some yourself !

Bring your laptop !

(PS: Same material will be given on 4, 11 and 18/09, so pick the date that is the easiest for you!).
name: Start to code for the Web (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) - free workshop

description:
You might have heard of GitHub, a social network (but quite different from Facebook ^^ ), where all is about code!
GitHub is based on Git, a utility developed by Linus Torvalds (the Linux guy). Git is key to all software development projects, because it manages and controls the many different versions of your code. Knowing Git will allow you to adopt best practices when you develop. It might even change your view on IT!

During our 3 hours workshop, we will install Git, create a first repository and learn to manipulate different versions of a file. We will also talk about branches and workflow. 

We will then be able to create a GithHub account and start to collaborate online! We will end up by learning how to deploy a website via Git through the GitHub Pages service.

Objectives:

• Get familiar with Git and control the different versions of your code thanks to it
• Collaborate with other developers on mutual projects through GitHub 
• Host a static website on GitHub Pages

Prerequisites:

Not much. Come with your computer and a text editor (SublimeText). If you have a Windows OS, install git on it. If you already tried to launch a command from a terminal, it will help, but it's not mandatory! ; )
name: Get intimate with Git & GitHub

description:
With some basic skills in Front-end & Design you can create your own landing page.

For those who are not familiar with Growth Hacking techniques, a landing page allows you to guide your traffic into business by a clear call-to-action. You then convert your anonymous visitors into real business leads ! 

Objective 
During this 3-hour workshop you will learn to make a landing page from scratch with HTML, CSS and some bootstrap tricks.
Your landing page will take into consideration the best practices for a high conversion rate of your traffic. 

Prerequisites
 Come as you are, with your computer and a text editor (SublimeText). 
This is a workshop for beginners.
name: Front-end & Design for Landing Pages

description:
Responsive websites are websites that look good from your phone to your 40' home cinema screen. Today such websites are no longer a plus, they are a must. Especially when you consider that over 50% of traffic comes from phones.

Luckily for us, the Bootstrap framework can help a lot on this specific subject. We'll discover what Bootstrap is, how we can use it for any website you want to build, and how to get a headstart using themes.

As usual, we're just here to help, you'll be building your website during the three-hours workshop.

A first experience with HTML will help, but is not mandatory. A good way to be ready for this Bootstrap workshop is either to come to our workshop about landing pages or try yourself with a few exercices on CodeAcademy!
name: Build Your Website With Bootstrap

description:
Launch Party of Le Wagon Brussels' Dev Bootcamp program at Co.Station! 

This Dev Bootcamp, a 2-months full-time training in Web application development for (half-)beginners. It is the first initiative of this kind in Belgium and it will start on 12th January 2015 in Brussels.

If you want to know more about it, come and discover, meet and discuss around a drink... or two on the 26th November for our launch event!

 
There will be a presentation of the courses, of the Brussels team, and lightning talks from the Paillard brothers (Le Wagon co-founders) and the CTO coming from Paris that night, and... some nice surprises too ! ;)

It's free and everybody is welcome ! 

In the meantime, or if you can't make it, have a look at the program on the website and the youtube channel. 


...and you can already apply here :
http://www.lewagon.org/brussels
name: Le Wagon Brussels­ Dev Bootcamp - A Night to Discover
